p: The essential oil has a fungistatic effect on the survival curve of C. albicans. It should be noted that in the case of azoles 20% yeast growth is allowed during the 48-h incubation [ 28]. It is important to observe that after 12 h of treatment the concentration of MIC 50 showed a decrease in the fungi population. Nevertheless, the increase of the fungi population with the FMC at 24 h was observed, this is probably due to trailing growth that is observed in the Candida species [ 29]. It is necessary to emphasize that the use of antifungals has been registered from the 1950s [ 30]. Since this time the development of antifungals against C. albicans always has been a priority for the scientific community. However, the prolonged management of candidiasis using antifungals might cause the development of drug-resistant candidiasis [ 12, 13, 14]. An alternative has involved the search for new treatments in medicinal plants.
